Definition.WordDefinition:
Simply \Sim"ply\, adv. 1. In a simple manner or state; considered in or by itself; without addition; along; merely; solely; barely. [1913 Webster]
[They] make that now good or evil, . . . which otherwise of itself were not simply the one or the other. --Hooker. [1913 Webster]
Simply the thing I am Shall make me live. --Shak. [1913 Webster]
2. Plainly; without art or subtlety. [1913 Webster]
Subverting worldly strong and worldly wise By simply meek. --Milton. [1913 Webster]
3. Weakly; foolishly. --Johnson. [1913 Webster]

simply adv 1: and nothing more; "I was merely asking"; "it is simply a matter of time"; "just a scratch"; "he was only a child"; "hopes that last but a moment" [syn: {merely}, {just}, {only}, {but}] 2: absolutely; altogether; really; "we are simply broke" 3: in a simple manner; without extravagance or embellishment; "she was dressed plainly"; "they lived very simply" [syn: {plainly}] 4: absolutely; "I just can't take it anymore"; "he was just grand as Romeo"; "it's simply beautiful!" [syn: {just}]
